author: pipermerriam
content: I'm syncing a geth archive node right now.  It's still 1year7months behind the tip of the chain and consuming 2.7 TB of disk.  I'm expecting it to be close 6-7TB by the time it is fully synced.  Disk is 3x 4TB SSD's in a logical volume.

author: chaserxy
content: sorry, I  should've been clearer -- I know how much an archive node weighs (https://etherscan.io/chartsync/chainarchive), what I wonder is how much of that can I store on the HDD.

author: pipermerriam
content: To the best of my knowledge, geth is going to need all of it on fast disk because it is just one massive leveldb database and there's no distinction between archive state and recent active state (it all lives in done database)
